title: East Fjords Exploration

image.alt: Dramatic coastal scenery of East Iceland with winding roads along fjords and mountains

quote.text: The East Fjords are where Iceland slows down, where each winding turn reveals another breathtaking vista, another reason to stop and stare in wonder.
quote.author: Alda Sigmundsdóttir

summary: Journey through Iceland's spectacular East Fjords, featuring dramatic coastal landscapes, mountain passes, and hidden waterfalls. From the iconic Vestrahorn mountain to the winding fjord roads and mineral collections, this day showcases Iceland's less-visited but equally stunning eastern region.

schedule.title: Breakfast near Höfn
schedule.description: Early breakfast at Netto bakery in Höfn, which opens early for travelers.

schedule.title: Drive to Vestrahorn
schedule.description: Short drive to one of Iceland's most photogenic mountains.

schedule.title: Vestrahorn and Stokksnes Beach
schedule.description: Explore this dramatic mountain backdrop with black sand beach. Outstanding photo opportunity with jagged peaks rising directly from the sea. Entry fee: $12 per person paid at Viking Café.

schedule.title: East Fjords Coastal Drive
schedule.description: Begin the spectacular coastal drive through the East Fjords with winding roads, fjord and mountain views. Multiple viewpoints for photos along the way. This is considered one of Iceland's most scenic drives.

schedule.title: The Waterfall Circle Hike
schedule.description: Magical hike featuring nearly ten diverse waterfalls. Trailhead at Laugarfell Guesthouse; moderate 5-mile loop taking about 3 hours. Pack a lunch to enjoy during the hike.

schedule.title: Drive to Djúpivogur village
schedule.description: Continue your journey to this charming coastal village.

schedule.title: Late Lunch at Við Voginn restaurant
schedule.description: Enjoy a late lunch at this local favorite in Djúpivogur. Note: A small cruise ship will be in port, so try to avoid peak times.

schedule.title: Drive to Petra's Stone Collection
schedule.description: Journey further along the coast to visit a unique mineral collection.

schedule.title: Petra's Stone Collection
schedule.description: Explore this massive private collection of East Iceland minerals, gathered over a lifetime by local resident Petra. Entry fee: $15 per person.

schedule.title: Drive to Vestdalsfossar
schedule.description: Short drive to a scenic waterfall viewpoint.

schedule.title: Vestdalsfossar waterfall viewpoint
schedule.description: Take in the views of this cascading waterfall set among the East Fjords.

schedule.title: Drive to Borgarfirdi Eystra
schedule.description: Final drive of the day to your accommodation, taking you through more stunning fjord landscapes.

schedule.title: Dinner at Alfheimar Hotel
schedule.description: Enjoy dinner at your hotel restaurant or Álfacafé nearby.

highlights.title: Vestrahorn and Stokksnes Beach
highlights.description: Dramatic mountain backdrop with black sand beach, considered one of Iceland's most photogenic locations.

highlights.title: East Fjords Coastal Drive
highlights.description: Winding roads with spectacular fjord and mountain views, offering some of Iceland's most impressive coastal scenery.

highlights.title: The Waterfall Circle
highlights.description: Hidden gem featuring a moderate hike with nearly ten diverse waterfalls, rarely visited by most tourists.

highlights.title: Petra's Stone Collection
highlights.description: Unique collection of minerals and stones collected by a local resident over decades, showcasing the geological diversity of East Iceland.

highlights.title: Djúpivogur Village
highlights.description: Charming fishing village with historic buildings, art installations, and coastal views.

accommodation.name: Alfheimar Hotel
accommodation.roomType: Standard Double or Twin Room, Patio
accommodation.notes: Located in the small village of Borgarfjörður Eystri, known for its puffin colony and hiking trails.

alternatives.title: Hengifoss and Litlanesfoss Waterfall Hike
alternatives.description: Hike to Iceland's third-highest waterfall with distinctive red strata rock layers (3-mile round trip, 2 hours).

alternatives.title: Atlavik Beach
alternatives.description: Peaceful fjord beach with golden sand, a rarity in Iceland.

alternatives.title: Papey Island Boat Tour
alternatives.description: Half-day boat tour to an uninhabited island with abundant birdlife and Iceland's oldest wooden church.

alternatives.title: Strútsfoss Waterfall
alternatives.description: Larger red strata waterfall than the famous Hengifoss, accessible via Road 935.

alternatives.title: Rauðaskriða
alternatives.description: Striking red hills with hiking trails and spectacular views.

badWeatherAlternatives.title: East Iceland Heritage Museum
badWeatherAlternatives.description: Museum showcasing the history and culture of East Iceland.

badWeatherAlternatives.title: Extended Visit to Petra's Stone Collection
badWeatherAlternatives.description: Spend more time exploring the extensive indoor mineral collection.

badWeatherAlternatives.title: Vök Baths
badWeatherAlternatives.description: Geothermal floating pools on Lake Urriðavatn with sauna and tea bar.

badWeatherAlternatives.title: Wilderness Center Exhibition
badWeatherAlternatives.description: Indoor exhibition about life in the Icelandic wilderness.

badWeatherAlternatives.title: Egilsstaðir Swimming Pool
badWeatherAlternatives.description: Indoor swimming pool with hot tubs - a classic Icelandic bad-weather activity.

tip: The East Fjords have some of Iceland's most dramatic and least crowded scenic drives. Allow extra time for spontaneous photo stops - you'll likely want to pull over frequently to capture the stunning landscapes.
notes: This is a long driving day with many stops (5+ hours total driving). Note there is a small cruise ship in port in Djúpivogur - you may want to avoid the village during peak midday hours. The Waterfall Circle hike is one of the best hidden gems in East Iceland but requires proper hiking footwear. There's a duplicate reservation to cancel as noted in the full itinerary.
